name: Angelic Page
text: Flying\n{T}: Target attacking or blocking creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: If only every message were as perfect as its messenger.

name: Ardent Militia
text: Vigilance
flavor: Knights fight for honor and mercenaries fight for gold. The militia fights for hearth and home.

name: Blessed Reversal
text: You gain 3 life for each creature attacking you.
flavor: "A battle's outcome is never certain."\n—The Southern Paladin

name: Breath of Life
text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
flavor: "Nothing can stop the power of life—not even death."\n—Onean cleric

name: Castle
text: Untapped creatures you control get +0/+2.
flavor:
". . . Our castle's strength
Will laugh a siege to scorn."
—William Shakespeare,
Macbeth

name: Circle of Protection: Black
text: {1}: The next time a black source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

name: Circle of Protection: Blue
text: {1}: The next time a blue source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

name: Circle of Protection: Green
text: {1}: The next time a green source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

name: Circle of Protection: Red
text: {1}: The next time a red source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

name: Circle of Protection: White
text: {1}: The next time a white source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

name: Cloudchaser Eagle
text: Flying\nWhen Cloudchaser Eagle enters the battlefield, destroy target enchantment.
flavor: Most eagles hunt small animals. The cloudchasers hunt magic.

name: Crossbow Infantry
text: {T}: Crossbow Infantry deals 1 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
flavor: Twang. You're dead.

name: Disenchant
text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

name: Eager Cadet
flavor: "Training? Seeing my crops burnt to cinders was all the ‘training' I needed."

name: Elite Archers
text: {T}: Elite Archers deals 3 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
flavor: They fletch their arrows with the feathers of angels.

name: Gerrard's Wisdom
text: You gain 2 life for each card in your hand.
flavor: A picture is worth a thousand swords.

name: Glorious Anthem
text: Creatures you control get +1/+1.
flavor: "North and South meet and angels sing.\nVoices resound with a righteous ring."\n—"The Ballad of the Paladins"

name: Healing Salve
text: Choose one —\n• Target player gains 3 life.\n• Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

name: Heavy Ballista
text: {T}: Heavy Ballista deals 2 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
flavor: "Soldiers wear down and enemies collapse—but the ballista never tires."\n—Ballista captain

name: Holy Strength
text: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature gets +1/+2.

name: Honor Guard
text: {W}: Honor Guard gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: The strength of one. The courage of ten.

name: Intrepid Hero
text: {T}: Destroy target creature with power 4 or greater.
flavor: A fool knows no fear. A hero shows no fear.

name: Kjeldoran Royal Guard
text: {T}: All combat damage that would be dealt to you by unblocked creatures this turn is dealt to Kjeldoran Royal Guard instead.
flavor: Honorable in battle, generous in death.\n—Motto of the Kjeldoran Royal Guard

name: Knight Errant
flavor: Knights are quick to pledge their loyalty and even quicker to charge into battle.

name: Knighthood
text: Creatures you control have first strike.
flavor: Kings don't make knights. Actions do.

name: Longbow Archer
text: First strike; reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
flavor: Some say they have the blood of hawks running through their veins.

name: Master Healer
text: {T}: Prevent the next 4 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
flavor: Her heart holds the pain of every soldier she's ever healed.

name: Northern Paladin
text: {W}{W}, {T}: Destroy target black permanent.
flavor: "How smooth his face, how sure his thoughts. I look forward to breaking his mighty will."\n—The Eastern Paladin

name: Pacifism
text: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature can't attack or block.
flavor: Without warriors there can be no war.

name: Pariah
text: Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)\nAll damage that would be dealt to you is dealt to enchanted creature instead.
flavor: A valiant knight's life has no meaning without honor.

name: Purify
text: Destroy all artifacts and enchantments.
flavor: "We have no need for these trinkets. We need only the strength of our swords and the virtue of our hearts."\n—The Northern Paladin

name: Razorfoot Griffin
text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)\nFirst strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
flavor: Like a meteor, it strikes from above without warning. Unlike a meteor, it then carries you off and eats you.

name: Reprisal
text: Destroy target creature with power 4 or greater. It can't be regenerated.
flavor: "Fear this no more!"

name: Reverse Damage
text: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage. You gain life equal to the damage prevented this way.
flavor: "Weapons usually bring death. Today, mine will bring life."

name: Rolling Stones
text: Wall creatures can attack as though they didn't have defender.
flavor: "We spent three weeks trying to knock that wall down. Now it's knocking us down."\n—Onean sergeant

name: Sacred Ground
text: Whenever a spell or ability an opponent controls causes a land to be put into your graveyard from the battlefield, return that card to the battlefield.
flavor: The land will never betray those who gave their lives for it.

name: Sacred Nectar
text: You gain 4 life.
flavor:
"For he on honey-dew hath fed,
And drunk the milk of Paradise."
—Samuel Taylor Coleridge,
"Kubla Khan"

name: Samite Healer
text: {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
flavor: Why does a Samite heal? You might as well ask why a bird flies.

name: Sanctimony
text: Whenever an opponent taps a Mountain for mana, you may gain 1 life.
flavor: "The peasants labor for my profit. I approve."

name: Seasoned Marshal
text: Whenever Seasoned Marshal attacks, you may tap target creature.
flavor: He reads the battlefield like a map, always seeking the shortest route to victory.

name: Serra Advocate
text: Flying\n{T}: Target attacking or blocking creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
flavor: An angel's blessing prepares a soldier for war better than a thousand military drills.

name: Serra Angel
text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)\nVigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)
flavor: Her sword sings more beautifully than any choir.

name: Serra's Embrace
text: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has flying and vigilance.
flavor: "With one breath, the newborn angel took to the air . . . and the world sighed."\n—The Book of Serra

name: Shield Wall
text: Creatures you control get +0/+2 until end of turn.
flavor: "If not for the wizard, we'd all be dead now. 'Course, it was him that started all this in the first place."\n—Onean veteran

name: Skyshroud Falcon
text: Flying, vigilance
flavor: The earliest mystics believed that the falcon slit the sky to let the light break through.

name: Southern Paladin
text: {W}{W}, {T}: Destroy target red permanent.
flavor: "How can anyone fight so much yet enjoy it so little?"\n—The Western Paladin

name: Spirit Link
text: Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)\nWhenever enchanted creature deals damage, you gain that much life.
flavor: The noble paladins draw strength from the courage of others.

name: Standing Troops
text: Vigilance
flavor: They fight so closely together a mouse couldn't slip past their guard.

name: Starlight
text: You gain 3 life for each black creature target opponent controls.
flavor: "Even in the darkest night\nStars and angels still shine bright."\n—Onean children's rhyme

name: Staunch Defenders
text: When Staunch Defenders enters the battlefield, you gain 4 life.
flavor: "The key to winning any fight is simply staying alive."\n—The Southern Paladin

name: Sunweb
text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)\nFlying\nSunweb can't block creatures with power 2 or less.
flavor: Sometimes the wings of fallen dragons refuse to give up the sky.

name: Sustainer of the Realm
text: Flying\nWhenever Sustainer of the Realm blocks, it gets +0/+2 until end of turn.
flavor: You may break her shield, but you'll never break her spirit.

name: Venerable Monk
text: When Venerable Monk enters the battlefield, you gain 2 life.
flavor: "I rely not so much on the wisdom of age as on the overconfidence of youth."

name: Vengeance
text: Destroy target tapped creature.
flavor: "It is the duty of the strong to oppose any who threaten the weak."\n—The Southern Paladin

name: Wall of Swords
text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)\nFlying
flavor: Sharper than wind, lighter than air.

name: Worship
text: If you control a creature, damage that would reduce your life total to less than 1 reduces it to 1 instead.
flavor: "Believe in the ideal, not the idol."\n—Serra

name: Wrath of God
text: Destroy all creatures. They can't be regenerated.

name: Air Elemental
text: Flying
flavor: Where psycho meets cyclone.

name: Ancestral Memories
text: Look at the top seven cards of your library. Put two of them into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.
flavor: "It's a poor sort of memory that only works backwards."\n—Lewis Carroll,\nThrough the Looking Glass

name: Arcane Laboratory
text: Each player can't cast more than one spell each turn.
flavor: Too many wizards spoil the spell, but too many spells spoil the wizard.\n—Sign on entry to arcane lab

name: Archivist
text: {T}: Draw a card.
flavor: "Knowledge is a feast for the mind. Savor every swallow."

name: Baleful Stare
text: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You draw a card for each Mountain and red card in it.
flavor: He can drown you in his eyes.

name: Benthic Behemoth
text: Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
flavor: The sea has many secrets, but some are too big to be kept.

name: Boomerang
text: Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
flavor: "Returne from whence ye came. . . ."\n—Edmund Spenser,\nThe Faerie Queene

name: Confiscate
text: Enchant permanent (Target a permanent as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that permanent.)\nYou control enchanted permanent.
flavor: "The surface world contains nothing I cannot take."\n—The Lord of Atlantis

name: Coral Merfolk
flavor: The coral merfolk delight in wrestling with their foes, skinning them alive on the razor-sharp edges of their reef.

name: Counterspell
text: Counter target spell.

name: Daring Apprentice
text: {T}, Sacrifice Daring Apprentice: Counter target spell.
flavor: "I've seen my master do this a hundred times. How hard can it be?"

name: Deflection
text: Change the target of target spell with a single target.
flavor: "You've thrown your net at the wrong fish."\n—The Lord of Atlantis

name: Delusions of Mediocrity
text: When Delusions of Mediocrity enters the battlefield, you gain 10 life.\nWhen Delusions of Mediocrity leaves the battlefield, you lose 10 life.
flavor: When nothing but second best will do.

name: Equilibrium
text: Whenever you cast a creature spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, return target creature to its owner's hand.
flavor: Seek balance in all things—as long as the scales are weighted in your favor.\n—Vodalian saying

name: Evacuation
text: Return all creatures to their owners' hands.
flavor: "How many people can you save in that thing?"\n"All of them," replied the mage with a smile.

name: Fighting Drake
text: Flying
flavor: Scholars in their ivory towers call them "sharks of the sky." Scholars on the road don't call them at all.

name: Fleeting Image
text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)\n{1}{U}: Return Fleeting Image to its owner's hand.
flavor: "It was as if we fought a shadow."\n—Onean soldier

name: Flight
text: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature has flying.

name: Force Spike
text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1}.
flavor: "I don't think so."

name: Giant Octopus
flavor: The only thing that flows faster than water is fear.

name: Glacial Wall
text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)
flavor: Like arguing with ice\n—Vodalian expression meaning\n"wasting your time"

name: Hibernation
text: Return all green permanents to their owners' hands.
flavor: The deep sleep of winter is not always restful.

name: Horned Turtle
flavor: It doesn't like having visitors . . . unless it's having them for lunch.

name: Inspiration
text: Target player draws two cards.

name: Levitation
text: Creatures you control have flying.
flavor: "We'll be easy targets if we remain on the ground. Let's take the fight to them."

name: Lord of Atlantis
text: Other Merfolk creatures get +1/+1 and have islandwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
flavor: A master of tactics, the Lord of Atlantis makes his people bold in battle merely by arriving to lead them.

name: Mahamoti Djinn
text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
flavor: Of royal blood among the spirits of the air, the Mahamoti djinn rides on the wings of the winds. As dangerous in the gambling hall as he is in battle, he is a master of trickery and misdirection.

name: Mana Breach
text: Whenever a player casts a spell, that player returns a land he or she controls to its owner's hand.
flavor: The mana that binds the world together can also tear it apart.

name: Mana Short
text: Tap all lands target player controls and empty his or her mana pool.
flavor: "Remove their power, and their will to fight will follow."\n—Tolarian wizard

name: Mawcor
text: Flying\n{T}: Mawcor deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
flavor: Neither head holds a brain—that's located somewhere in the chest—but four eyes aim much better than two.

name: Memory Lapse
text: Counter target spell. If that spell is countered this way, put it on top of its owner's library instead of into that player's graveyard.
flavor: "Eri phar phesta . . . um, phistor . . . er, phistara . . ."

name: Merfolk Looter
text: {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.
flavor: When you sink a lot of ships, it's easy to find sunken treasure.

name: Merfolk of the Pearl Trident
flavor: "The paladins would be wise not to forget about the Pearl Trident. The merfolk warriors have turned the tide of more than one human war . . . and I have no doubt they shall do so again."\n—Onean scholar

name: Opportunity
text: Target player draws four cards.
flavor: Little things like morals shouldn't hinder one's ambition.\n—Pirate creed

name: Opposition
text: Tap an untapped creature you control: Tap target artifact, creature, or land.
flavor: Exhausting a wizard can be exhausting work.

name: Phantom Warrior
text: Phantom Warrior can't be blocked.
flavor: It can pass through solid matter—but that doesn't mean it's harmless.

name: Prodigal Sorcerer
text: {T}: Prodigal Sorcerer deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
flavor: He wastes his amazing talents on proving how amazing he really is.

name: Remove Soul
text: Counter target creature spell.

name: Sage Owl
text: Flying\nWhen Sage Owl enters the battlefield, look at the top four cards of your library, then put them back in any order.

name: Sea Monster
text: Sea Monster can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
flavor: "Abandon ship!"

name: Sleight of Hand
text: Look at the top two cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the other on the bottom of your library.
flavor: "Most people believe magic is only a trick. Why change their minds?"

name: Steal Artifact
text: Enchant artifact\nYou control enchanted artifact.

name: Storm Crow
text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
flavor: Storm crow descending, winter unending.\nStorm crow departing, summer is starting.

name: Telepathic Spies
text: When Telepathic Spies enters the battlefield, look at target opponent's hand.
flavor: Most spies sneak into enemy camps. These spies sneak into enemy minds.

name: Telepathy
text: Your opponents play with their hands revealed.
flavor: "Secrets? What secrets?"

name: Temporal Adept
text: {U}{U}{U}, {T}: Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
flavor: "Of course she's at the head of her class. All of her classmates have disappeared."\n—Tolarian renegade

name: Thieving Magpie
text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)\nWhenever Thieving Magpie deals damage to an opponent, draw a card.
flavor: Other birds collect twigs for their nests. Magpies steal jewels for theirs.

name: Tolarian Winds
text: Discard all the cards in your hand, then draw that many cards.
flavor: Why not ask the winds?\n—Tolarian expression meaning\n"Who knows?"

name: Treasure Trove
text: {2}{U}{U}: Draw a card.
flavor: "Nope, there's nothing here either. You guys go on ahead, I'll catch up in a minute. . . . Whoo hoo!"

name: Twiddle
text: You may tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land.

name: Unsummon
text: Return target creature to its owner's hand.

name: Vigilant Drake
text: Flying\n{2}{U}: Untap Vigilant Drake.
flavor: It can stay aloft for weeks with little or no sleep.

name: Vizzerdrix
flavor: A bored wizard once created a vizzerdrix out of a bunny and a piranha. He never made that mistake again.

name: Wall of Air
text: Defender, flying (This creature can't attack, and it can block creatures with flying.)
flavor: "Let the air itself protect you, for it is everywhere."\n—Master wizard

name: Wall of Wonder
text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)\n{2}{U}{U}: Wall of Wonder gets +4/-4 until end of turn and can attack this turn as though it didn't have defender.
flavor: They wondered at the size of it. It wondered which to eat first.

name: Wind Dancer
text: Flying\n{T}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
flavor: The sky is her stage.

name: Wind Drake
text: Flying
flavor:
"But high she shoots through air and light,
Above all low delay,
Where nothing earthly bounds her flight,
Nor shadow dims her way."
—Thomas Moore,
"Oh that I had Wings"

name: Abyssal Horror
text: Flying\nWhen Abyssal Horror enters the battlefield, target player discards two cards.
flavor: "I dreamt of it once. Now I fear it dreams of me."\n—Tolarian scholar

name: Abyssal Specter
text: Flying\nWhenever Abyssal Specter deals damage to a player, that player discards a card.
flavor: To gaze under its hood is to invite death.

name: Agonizing Memories
text: Look at target player's hand and choose two cards from it. Put them on top of that player's library in any order.
flavor: "I think little of the foes I've slain. But I'm haunted by the friends I've sent to die."\n—The Southern Paladin

name: Befoul
text: Destroy target land or nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
flavor: The bog's touch means death to all but the darkest of hearts.

name: Bellowing Fiend
text: Flying\nWhenever Bellowing Fiend deals damage to a creature, Bellowing Fiend deals 3 damage to that creature's controller and 3 damage to you.

name: Bereavement
text: Whenever a green creature dies, its controller discards a card.
flavor: Grief is a razor that slices the soul.

name: Blood Pet
text: Sacrifice Blood Pet: Add {B} to your mana pool.
flavor: No thrull has ever been burdened with a long life.

name: Bog Imp
text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
flavor: Think of it as a butcher knife with wings.

name: Bog Wraith
text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
flavor: The bodies of its victims are the only tracks it leaves.

name: Corrupt
text: Corrupt deals damage equal to the number of Swamps you control to target creature or player. You gain life equal to the damage dealt this way.

name: Crypt Rats
text: {X}: Crypt Rats deals X damage to each creature and each player. Spend only black mana on X.
flavor: Beware anything born among the dead.\n—Tolarian saying

name: Dakmor Lancer
text: When Dakmor Lancer enters the battlefield, destroy target nonblack creature.
flavor: The darkness of his shield reflects the inky blackness of his soul.

name: Dark Banishing
text: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
flavor: "Hence ‘banishèd' is banished from the world, / And the world's exile is death."\n—William Shakespeare,\nRomeo and Juliet

name: Darkest Hour
text: All creatures are black.
flavor: The eclipse made it clear whose side the sky was on.

name: Dregs of Sorrow
text: Destroy X target nonblack creatures. Draw X cards.
flavor: "We live for a thousand years. The death of even one brings untold sorrow."\n—Elvish elder

name: Drudge Skeletons
text: {B}: Regenerate Drudge Skeletons. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
flavor: "The dead make good soldiers. They can't disobey orders, they never surrender, and they don't stop fighting when a random body part falls off."\n—Nevinyrral,\nNecromancer's Handbook

name: Duress
text: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a noncreature, nonland card from it. That player discards that card.
flavor: "Change your mind, or I'll change it for you."

name: Eastern Paladin
text: {B}{B}, {T}: Destroy target green creature.
flavor: "There is no worse enemy. His passion for death doesn't just border on insanity, it wallows in it."\n—The Southern Paladin

name: Engineered Plague
text: As Engineered Plague enters the battlefield, choose a creature type.\nAll creatures of the chosen type get -1/-1.
flavor: A single germ can kill more soldiers than ten thousand blades.

name: Fallen Angel
text: Flying\nSacrifice a creature: Fallen Angel gets +2/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: "Why do you weep for the dead? I rejoice, for they have died for me."\n—Fallen angel, to Serra

name: Fear
text: Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)\nEnchanted creature has fear. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
flavor: "Booga booga booga!"

name: Foul Imp
text: Flying\nWhen Foul Imp enters the battlefield, you lose 2 life.
flavor: The villagers call it "winged stench."

name: Fugue
text: Target player discards three cards.
flavor: "It's hard to keep our own troops from fleeing when he's like this. How can our foes possibly stand against him?"\n—Field marshal for the Eastern Paladin

name: Giant Cockroach
flavor: Toren had stepped on a lot of bugs during his life, so he couldn't help feeling embarrassed when a bug stepped on him.

name: Gravedigger
text: When Gravedigger enters the battlefield, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: A full coffin is like a full coffer—both are attractive to thieves.

name: Greed
text: {B}, Pay 2 life: Draw a card.
flavor: An advisor once asked the Western Paladin how much gold would be enough. "I have no need of fools who can imagine ‘enough,'" he told the advisor's corpse.

name: Hollow Dogs
text: Whenever Hollow Dogs attacks, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: A hollow dog is never empty. It is filled with thirst for the hunt.

name: Howl from Beyond
text: Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: Whether it howls for hunger or for joy, you're in trouble just the same.

name: Infernal Contract
text: Draw four cards. You lose half your life, rounded up.
flavor: "East and West meet and angels cry.\nUnholy power darkens the sky."\n—"The Ballad of the Paladins"

name: Leshrac's Rite
text: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature has swampwalk. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
flavor: "Brackish water, dark and blind\nHeed my will, to you I bind."\n—Opening passage of Leshrac's Rite

name: Looming Shade
text: {B}: Looming Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor: On darkness feeding, in nightmares breeding.

name: Megrim
text: Whenever an opponent discards a card, Megrim deals 2 damage to that player.
flavor: Memories cut from the mind can cut right back.

name: Mind Rot
text: Target player discards two cards.
flavor: What wizards fear most is losing their minds.

name: Nausea
text: All creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn.
flavor: No fear. No sense. And soon, no lunch.

name: Necrologia
text: Cast Necrologia only during your end step.\nAs an additional cost to cast Necrologia, pay X life.\nDraw X cards.

name: Nightmare
text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)\nNightmare's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Swamps you control.
flavor: The thunder of its hooves beats dreams into despair.

name: Nocturnal Raid
text: Black creatures get +2/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: The Eastern Paladin doesn't attack at night for the tactical advantage. He does it for the sheer joy of fighting beneath the moon.

name: Oppression
text: Whenever a player casts a spell, that player discards a card.
flavor: "Defeating an enemy is not nearly as satisfying as watching one suffer."\n—The Western Paladin

name: Ostracize
text: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a creature card from it. That player discards that card.
flavor: "You won't be needing this."

name: Persecute
text: Choose a color. Target player reveals his or her hand and discards all cards of that color.
flavor: "I want every last one of these tree-hugging, earth-loving, pointy-eared weaklings out of here. Now!"

name: Plague Beetle
text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
flavor: No one knows whether they were named for the diseases they carry or for the speed at which they multiply.

name: Rag Man
text: {B}{B}{B}, {T}: Target opponent reveals his or her hand and discards a creature card at random. Activate this ability only during your turn.
flavor: He hunts what might have been.

name: Raise Dead
text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor: The earth cannot hold that which magic commands.

name: Razortooth Rats
text: Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
flavor: They'll chew through armor, flesh, and bone. They'll even chew through each other if they're hungry enough.

name: Reprocess
text: Sacrifice any number of artifacts, creatures, and/or lands. Draw a card for each permanent sacrificed this way.
flavor: The battle's end is the meal's beginning.

name: Revenant
text: Flying\nRevenant's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creature cards in your graveyard.
flavor: It eats death and drinks pain.

name: Scathe Zombies
flavor:
"They groaned, they stirred, they all uprose,
Nor spake, nor moved their eyes;
It had been strange, even in a dream,
To have seen those dead men rise."
—Samuel Taylor Coleridge,
"The Rime of the Ancient Mariner"

name: Serpent Warrior
text: When Serpent Warrior enters the battlefield, you lose 3 life.
flavor: They're the fiercest of all the Western Paladin's soldiers. They're also the most fiercely loyal—but that loyalty comes at a price.

name: Soul Feast
text: Target player loses 4 life and you gain 4 life.
flavor: You are who you eat.

name: Spineless Thug
text: Spineless Thug can't block.
flavor: What it lacks in backbone, it makes up for in cruelty.

name: Strands of Night
text: {B}{B}, Pay 2 life, Sacrifice a Swamp: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
flavor: When the strands call, only the dead answer.

name: Stronghold Assassin
text: {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Destroy target nonblack creature.
flavor: The assassin sees only throats and hears only heartbeats.

name: Tainted Æther
text: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield, its controller sacrifices a creature or land.
flavor: Pockets of Æther can be so foul they melt flesh from bone.

name: Unholy Strength
text: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature gets +2/+1.
flavor: "I don't feel any different."

name: Wall of Bone
text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)\n{B}: Regenerate Wall of Bone. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
flavor: A skeletal wall, strengthened by the souls of traitors, rings the city of the Eastern Paladin.

name: Western Paladin
text: {B}{B}, {T}: Destroy target white creature.
flavor: "Expect nothing but scorn, flattery, and lies. And never turn your back on him."\n—The Northern Paladin

name: Yawgmoth's Edict
text: Whenever an opponent casts a white spell, that player loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.
flavor: The warping of bodies and souls has become the heart of Yawgmoth's existence.

name: Æther Flash
text: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield, Æther Flash deals 2 damage to it.
flavor: As the foul beast appeared, arcane lightning crackled around it.

name: Balduvian Barbarians
flavor:
"From the snowy slopes of Kaelor,
To the canyons of Bandu,
We drink and fight and feast and die
As we were born to do."
—Balduvian tavern song

name: Bedlam
text: Creatures can't block.
flavor: The generals were dead. The battle plans were forgotten. It was everyone for themselves.

name: Blaze
text: Blaze deals X damage to target creature or player.
flavor: Fire never dies alone.

name: Bloodshot Cyclops
text: {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Bloodshot Cyclops deals damage equal to the sacrificed creature's power to target creature or player.
flavor: After their first encounter, the goblins named him Chuck.

name: Boil
text: Destroy all Islands.
flavor: "It is a slaughter, the death of a sea. Never speak of it again."\n—The Lord of Atlantis

name: Crimson Hellkite
text: Flying\n{X}, {T}: Crimson Hellkite deals X damage to target creature. Spend only red mana on X.
flavor: The hellkites are artists with flames, painting the world with fire.

name: Disorder
text: Disorder deals 2 damage to each white creature and each player who controls a white creature.
flavor: "Fire hurts them almost as much as the chaos that follows. Almost."\n—The Western Paladin

name: Earthquake
text: Earthquake deals X damage to each creature without flying and each player.

name: Fervor
text: Creatures you control have haste. (They can attack and {T} as soon as they come under your control.)
flavor: The intensity of their glare was soon surpassed by the intensity of their attack.

name: Final Fortune
text: Take an extra turn after this one. At the beginning of that turn's end step, you lose the game.
flavor: A reward is worthless if you aren't around to enjoy it.

name: Fire Elemental
flavor: It treads on feet of coals and strikes with the force of a volcano.

name: Ghitu Fire-Eater
text: {T}, Sacrifice Ghitu Fire-Eater: Ghitu Fire-Eater deals damage equal to its power to target creature or player.
flavor: The Ghitu believe their race was born of fire, and it's an honor to return to it.

name: Goblin Chariot
text: Haste (This creature can attack the turn it comes under your control.)
flavor: The hardest part of his training is learning not to eat the boar.

name: Goblin Digging Team
text: {T}, Sacrifice Goblin Digging Team: Destroy target Wall.
flavor: "Dig. Dig. Dig. Dig. Dig. Dig. Die"\n—Goblin chant

name: Goblin Elite Infantry
text: Whenever Goblin Elite Infantry blocks or becomes blocked, it gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
flavor: We're elite. You're not.\n—Infantry motto

name: Goblin Gardener
text: When Goblin Gardener dies, destroy target land.
flavor: Years of attempts have brought the goblins no closer to growing a sausage tree.

name: Goblin Glider
text: Flying\nGoblin Glider can't block.
flavor: "What's got two arms, one wing, and no brains?"\n—Ghitu riddle

name: Goblin King
text: Other Goblin creatures get +1/+1 and have mountainwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
flavor: To be king, Numsgil did in Blog, who did in Unkful, who did in Viddle, who did in Loll, who did in Alrok. . . .

name: Goblin Matron
text: When Goblin Matron enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a Goblin card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.

name: Goblin Raider
text: Goblin Raider can't block.
flavor: He's smart for a goblin. He can do two things: hit and run.

name: Goblin Spelunkers
text: Mountainwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
flavor: Goblins prefer caves to just about anything else. Caves prefer just about anything else to goblins.

name: Goblin War Drums
text: Creatures you control have menace. (They can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
flavor: The goblin idea of music is to hit something with a stick.

name: Granite Grip
text: Enchant creature\nEnchanted creature gets +1/+0 for each Mountain you control.
flavor: "Let me introduce you to Rocky."

name: Hill Giant
flavor: Hill giants are mostly just big. Of course, that does count for a lot.

name: Impatience
text: At the beginning of each player's end step, if that player didn't cast a spell this turn, Impatience deals 2 damage to him or her.
flavor: "I'm going to count to three. Three."

name: Inferno
text: Inferno deals 6 damage to each creature and each player.
flavor: "Some have said there is no subtlety to destruction. You know what? They're dead."\n—Wandering mage

name: Lava Axe
text: Lava Axe deals 5 damage to target player.
flavor: "Catch!"

name: Lightning Blast
text: Lightning Blast deals 4 damage to target creature or player.
flavor: "I'll climb down soon. Don't worry, it's just a thundersto—"\n—Former elvish scout

name: Lightning Elemental
text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
flavor: "A flash of the lightning, a break of the wave,\nHe passes from life to his rest in the grave."\n—William Knox, "Mortality"

name: Mana Clash
text: You and target opponent each flip a coin. Mana Clash deals 1 damage to each player whose coin comes up tails. Repeat this process until both players' coins come up heads on the same flip.

name: Ogre Taskmaster
text: Ogre Taskmaster can't block.
flavor: Ogres learn how to smash stuff even before they learn how to walk.

name: Okk
text: Okk can't attack unless a creature with greater power also attacks.\nOkk can't block unless a creature with greater power also blocks.

name: Orcish Artillery
text: {T}: Orcish Artillery deals 2 damage to target creature or player and 3 damage to you.
flavor: "Ready . . . aim . . . fire"\n"Ow"

name: Orcish Oriflamme
text: Attacking creatures you control get +1/+0.

name: Pillage
text: Destroy target artifact or land. It can't be regenerated.
flavor: "Burn their homes. Salt their lands. Nothing survives."\n—The Western Paladin

name: Pygmy Pyrosaur
text: Pygmy Pyrosaur can't block.\n{R}: Pygmy Pyrosaur gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: Do not judge a lizard by its size.\n—Ghitu proverb

name: Pyroclasm
text: Pyroclasm deals 2 damage to each creature.
flavor: "When the air burns, only death breathes deep."\n—Bogardan mage

name: Pyrotechnics
text: Pyrotechnics deals 4 damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures and/or players.
flavor: "Who says lightning never strikes twice?"\n—Storm shaman

name: Raging Goblin
text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
flavor: He raged at the world, at his family, at his life. But mostly he just raged.

name: Reckless Embermage
text: {1}{R}: Reckless Embermage deals 1 damage to target creature or player and 1 damage to itself.
flavor: Those who play with fire are bound to get burned.

name: Reflexes
text: Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)\nEnchanted creature has first strike. (It deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
flavor: "Be as fast as lightning, and you will be just as deadly."\n—Combat trainer

name: Relentless Assault
text: Untap all creatures that attacked this turn. After this main phase, there is an additional combat phase followed by an additional main phase.
flavor: "Mercy? Mercy is for the playground, not the battleground."

name: Sabretooth Tiger
text: First strike
flavor: "Here, kitty kitty. Here, kitty kitty. Aaaaugh!"

name: Seismic Assault
text: Discard a land card: Seismic Assault deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
flavor: Earth arms itself with fire.

name: Shatter
text: Destroy target artifact.

name: Shivan Dragon
text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)\n{R}: Shivan Dragon gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: The undisputed master of the mountains of Shiv.

name: Shock
text: Shock deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

name: Spitting Earth
text: Spitting Earth deals damage to target creature equal to the number of Mountains you control.
flavor: "We were ready for an attack from the front, sides, or back—but the mage hit us from below."\n—Veteran soldier

name: Stone Rain
text: Destroy target land.

name: Storm Shaman
text: {R}: Storm Shaman gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: She speaks with the voice of the winds, and the earth trembles.

name: Sudden Impact
text: Sudden Impact deals damage to target player equal to the number of cards in that player's hand.
flavor: Caught red-handed.

name: Trained Orgg
flavor: "That arm's for bashin'. That one's for smashin'. That one's for scratchin'. And that one . . . I don't know what that one's for."\n—Orgg trainer

name: Tremor
text: Tremor deals 1 damage to each creature without flying.
flavor: Where do you run when the earth becomes your enemy?

name: Volcanic Hammer
text: Volcanic Hammer deals 3 damage to target creature or player.
flavor: Fire finds its form in the heat of the forge.

name: Wall of Fire
text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)\n{R}: Wall of Fire gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
flavor: The erupting flames work as both barrier and weapon.

name: Wildfire
text: Each player sacrifices four lands. Wildfire deals 4 damage to each creature.
flavor: Fire is always at the top of the food chain, and it has a big appetite.

name: Anaconda
text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
flavor: You'll never find an anaconda in a swamp. It will always find you first.

name: Ancient Silverback
text: {G}: Regenerate Ancient Silverback. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
flavor: The Phyrexian killing machines couldn't have known the seriousness of their mistake in wounding the ape—they'd never seen it angry.

name: Birds of Paradise
text: Flying\n{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

name: Blanchwood Armor
text: Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)\nEnchanted creature gets +1/+1 for each Forest you control.
flavor: "There's never been a dwarven smith who could match the marvels that Gaea herself forges."\n—The Elvish Champion

name: Bull Hippo
text: Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
flavor: The merfolk may rule the waters, but hippos have never had much respect for authority.

name: Canopy Spider
text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
flavor: It keeps the upper reaches of the forest free of every menace . . . except for the spider itself.

name: Compost
text: Whenever a black card is put into an opponent's graveyard from anywhere, you may draw a card.
flavor: A fruit must rot before its seed can sprout.\n—Yavimaya saying

name: Creeping Mold
text: Destroy target artifact, enchantment, or land.
flavor: Mold crept over the walls and into every crevice until the gleaming white stone strained and burst.

name: Early Harvest
text: Target player untaps all basic lands he or she controls.
flavor: "Give it a week and it will feed an army."

name: Elder Druid
text: {3}{G}, {T}: You may tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land.
flavor: "I may seem wise to you, but I'm merely a sapling among mighty oaks."

name: Elvish Archers
text: First strike
flavor: The archers have a reputation for attacking without warning. They claim that the first arrow is the warning.

name: Elvish Champion
text: Other Elf creatures get +1/+1 and have forestwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
flavor: "For what are leaves but countless blades\nTo fight a countless foe on high."\n—Elvish hymn

name: Elvish Lyrist
text: {G}, {T}, Sacrifice Elvish Lyrist: Destroy target enchantment.
flavor: To an elf, magic and music are the same.

name: Elvish Piper
text: {G}, {T}: You may put a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield.
flavor: From Gaea grew the world, and the world was silent. From Gaea grew the world's elves, and the world was silent no more.\n—Elvish teaching

name: Familiar Ground
text: Each creature you control can't be blocked by more than one creature.
flavor: More than any other battlefield, the forest gives the advantage to those who know it best.

name: Femeref Archers
text: {T}: Femeref Archers deals 4 damage to target attacking creature with flying.
flavor: "Bet you can't put it through the eye."\n"Left or right?"

name: Fog
text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.

name: Fyndhorn Elder
text: {T}: Add {G}{G} to your mana pool.
flavor: "It is useful to be able to speak to the trees. But it is truly wondrous to be able to listen to them."

name: Gang of Elk
text: Whenever Gang of Elk becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn for each creature blocking it.
flavor: "I felt the ground shake, so I hid in my tent until the earthquake passed. It passed all right, and it left hoofprints."\n—Femeref explorer

name: Giant Growth
text: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

name: Giant Spider
text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
flavor: Watching the spider's web\n—Llanowar expression meaning\n"focusing on the wrong thing"

name: Gorilla Chieftain
text: {1}{G}: Regenerate Gorilla Chieftain.
flavor: A gorilla chief must always be prepared to defend his crown. This leads to some pretty tough apes.

name: Grizzly Bears
flavor: They've got claws as long as your arm. And they're grouchy. Really, really grouchy.

name: Hurricane
text: Hurricane deals X damage to each creature with flying and each player.

name: Llanowar Elves
text: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
flavor: Llanowar covers a million square miles, yet nobody enters the forest without the elves knowing it.

name: Lone Wolf
text: You may have Lone Wolf assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.
flavor: A wolf without a pack is either a survivor or a brute.

name: Lure
text: Enchant creature\nAll creatures able to block enchanted creature do so.
flavor: "When the forest wants something, no mortal mind can resist her."\n—Maro

name: Maro
text: Maro's power and toughness are each equal to the number of cards in your hand.
flavor: No two see the same Maro.

name: Might of Oaks
text: Target creature gets +7/+7 until end of turn.
flavor: "Guess where I'm gonna plant this!"

name: Monstrous Growth
text: Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.
flavor: Get in touch with your inner monster.

name: Nature's Resurgence
text: Each player draws a card for each creature card in his or her graveyard.
flavor: "The dead whisper to the living. If you listen, you will learn."\n—Maro

name: Nature's Revolt
text: All lands are 2/2 creatures that are still lands.
flavor: The land rises up to defend against those who would spoil its beauty.

name: Pride of Lions
text: You may have Pride of Lions assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.
flavor: There's only one thing worse than a hungry lion—many hungry lions.

name: Rampant Growth
text: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.
flavor: Nature grows solutions to her problems.

name: Reclaim
text: Put target card from your graveyard on top of your library.
flavor: The wise pay as much attention to what they throw away as to what they keep.

name: Redwood Treefolk
flavor: And would you strip the bark from a treefolk?\n—Elvish expression meaning\n"Are you crazy?"

name: Regeneration
text: Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)\n{G}: Regenerate enchanted creature. (The next time that creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
flavor: "Why should death always have the last word?"\n—Llanowar druid

name: Rowen
text: Reveal the first card you draw each turn. Whenever you reveal a basic land card this way, draw a card.
flavor: Those who understand the forest are free to harvest its bounty.

name: Scavenger Folk
text: {G}, {T}, Sacrifice Scavenger Folk: Destroy target artifact.
flavor: "One piece? Now there's a hundred!"

name: Seeker of Skybreak
text: {T}: Untap target creature.
flavor: Seekers spend their lives protecting a home they rarely visit.

name: Shanodin Dryads
text: Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
flavor: Where dryads dance, seeds sprout and flowers bloom.

name: Spined Wurm
flavor: "I wouldn't stand in front of that wurm, son. 'Course, I wouldn't stand behind it neither. In fact, standing anywhere near that wurm's not much of a plan. Running, now that's a plan"\n—Wandering mage

name: Squall
text: Squall deals 2 damage to each creature with flying.
flavor: "May the winds blow till they have wakened death. . . ."\n—William Shakespeare,\nOthello

name: Stream of Life
text: Target player gains X life.

name: Thorn Elemental
text: You may have Thorn Elemental assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.
flavor: Rain from this storm leaves you pinned to the ground like an insect.

name: Thoughtleech
text: Whenever an Island an opponent controls becomes tapped, you may gain 1 life.
flavor: "Their thoughts flow through my mind, and I am healed."\n—Fyndhorn elder

name: Trained Armodon
flavor: Armodons are trained to step on things. Enemy things.

name: Tranquility
text: Destroy all enchantments.

name: Treefolk Seedlings
text: Treefolk Seedlings's toughness is equal to the number of Forests you control.
flavor: Even the grandest forest begins with a single seedling.\n—Llanowar saying

name: Uktabi Wildcats
text: Uktabi Wildcats's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Forests you control.\n{G}, Sacrifice a Forest: Regenerate Uktabi Wildcats.

name: Untamed Wilds
text: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
flavor: No forest is so remote that the elves don't know its secrets.

name: Verduran Enchantress
text: Whenever you cast an enchantment spell, you may draw a card.
flavor: Each spell has its own song, and the enchantress knows the dance for each.

name: Vernal Bloom
text: Whenever a Forest is tapped for mana, its controller adds {G} to his or her mana pool (in addition to the mana the land produces).
flavor: Spring breathes the magic of new life.

name: Wild Growth
text: Enchant land\nWhenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds {G} to his or her mana pool (in addition to the mana the land produces).
flavor: If you stop to listen, you can hear it grow.

name: Wing Snare
text: Destroy target creature with flying.
flavor: The elves long ago mastered the art of hunting with nets. They call it "fishing the sky."

name: Wood Elves
text: When Wood Elves enters the battlefield, search your library for a Forest card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
flavor: Every branch a crossroads, every vine a swift steed.

name: Yavimaya Enchantress
text: Yavimaya Enchantress gets +1/+1 for each enchantment on the battlefield.
flavor: Her roots connect her to the forest's wishes.

name: Aladdin's Ring
text: {8}, {T}: Aladdin's Ring deals 4 damage to target creature or player.
flavor: Some say Aladdin's third wish was for this ring.

name: Beast of Burden
text: Beast of Burden's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creatures on the battlefield.
flavor: The heavier the load, the harder it works.

name: Caltrops
text: Whenever a creature attacks, Caltrops deals 1 damage to it.
flavor: The Eastern Paladin knew how highly his southern rival valued horses, so he gleefully prepared a suitable welcome.

name: Charcoal Diamond
text: Charcoal Diamond enters the battlefield tapped.\n{T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.

name: Coat of Arms
text: Each creature gets +1/+1 for each other creature on the battlefield that shares at least one creature type with it. (For example, if two Goblin Warriors and a Goblin Shaman are on the battlefield, each gets +2/+2.)

name: Crystal Rod
text: Whenever a player casts a blue spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
flavor: Polished by a thousand waves.

name: Dingus Egg
text: Whenever a land is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, Dingus Egg deals 2 damage to that land's controller.
flavor: Legend has it that the world was hatched from a dingus egg.

name: Disrupting Scepter
text: {3}, {T}: Target player discards a card. Activate this ability only during your turn.

name: Ensnaring Bridge
text: Creatures with power greater than the number of cards in your hand can't attack.
flavor: Bridges usually get you from one place to another. This one just gets you.

name: Feroz's Ban
text: Creature spells cost {2} more to cast.
flavor: Feroz is gone, but what remains is his final gift to his people: the right to be left alone.

name: Fire Diamond
text: Fire Diamond enters the battlefield tapped.\n{T}: Add {R} to your mana pool.

name: Flying Carpet
text: {2}, {T}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
flavor: "Wheeeeeeeeeeeeeee!"

name: Grafted Skullcap
text: At the beginning of your draw step, draw an additional card.\nAt the beginning of your end step, discard your hand.
flavor: "Every day, I fight for my life and win. Every night, I fight to remember my name and lose."

name: Grapeshot Catapult
text: {T}: Grapeshot Catapult deals 1 damage to target creature with flying.
flavor: The Southern Paladin taught the airborne vermin to fear the storm that rains upward.

name: Howling Mine
text: At the beginning of each player's draw step, if Howling Mine is untapped, that player draws an additional card.
flavor: Legend has it that the mine howls out the last words of those who died inside.

name: Iron Star
text: Whenever a player casts a red spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
flavor: Forged by a thousand flames.

name: Ivory Cup
text: Whenever a player casts a white spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
flavor: Blessed by a thousand prayers.

name: Jalum Tome
text: {2}, {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.
flavor: Most books simply deliver knowledge. This one expects some in return.

name: Jandor's Saddlebags
text: {3}, {T}: Untap target creature.
flavor: Your heart's desire is found within.\n—Saddlebag inscription

name: Jayemdae Tome
text: {4}, {T}: Draw a card.
flavor: "Knowledge is power."\n—Sir Francis Bacon,\nMeditationes Sacrae

name: Marble Diamond
text: Marble Diamond enters the battlefield tapped.\n{T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.

name: Meekstone
text: Creatures with power 3 or greater don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
flavor: The bigger they are, the stronger its pull.

name: Millstone
text: {2}, {T}: Target player puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
flavor: More than one mage has been driven insane by the sound of the millstone relentlessly grinding away.

name: Moss Diamond
text: Moss Diamond enters the battlefield tapped.\n{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.

name: Patagia Golem
text: {3}: Patagia Golem gains flying until end of turn.
flavor: Its wings were only designed to be ornamental, but it learned to use them on its own.

name: Phyrexian Colossus
text: Phyrexian Colossus doesn't untap during your untap step.\nPay 8 life: Untap Phyrexian Colossus.\nPhyrexian Colossus can't be blocked except by three or more creatures.

name: Phyrexian Hulk
flavor:
It doesn't think. It doesn't feel.
It doesn't laugh or cry.
All it does from dusk till dawn
Is make the soldiers die.
—Onean children's rhyme

name: Pit Trap
text: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice Pit Trap: Destroy target attacking creature without flying. It can't be regenerated.
flavor: Never forget your feet\n—Elvish expression meaning\n"watch your step"

name: Rod of Ruin
text: {3}, {T}: Rod of Ruin deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
flavor: The rod is a relic from ancient times . . . cruel, vicious, mean-spirited times.

name: Sisay's Ring
text: {T}: Add {C}{C} to your mana pool.
flavor: "I'm not one for pretty things," said Sisay. "Unless they're pretty useful as well."

name: Sky Diamond
text: Sky Diamond enters the battlefield tapped.\n{T}: Add {U} to your mana pool.

name: Soul Net
text: Whenever a creature dies, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

name: Spellbook
text: You have no maximum hand size.
flavor: Knowledge knows no bounds.

name: Static Orb
text: As long as Static Orb is untapped, players can't untap more than two permanents during their untap steps.
flavor: The warriors fought against the paralyzing waves until even their thoughts froze in place.

name: Storm Cauldron
text: Each player may play an additional land during each of his or her turns.\nWhenever a land is tapped for mana, return it to its owner's hand.

name: Teferi's Puzzle Box
text: At the beginning of each player's draw step, that player puts the cards in his or her hand on the bottom of his or her library in any order, then draws that many cards.

name: Throne of Bone
text: Whenever a player casts a black spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
flavor: Tainted by a thousand fears.

name: Wall of Spears
text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)\nFirst strike
flavor: "A stick is your friend. A pointed stick is your good friend. An army of pointed sticks is your best friend."\n—Onean sergeant

name: Wooden Sphere
text: Whenever a player casts a green spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
flavor: Strengthened by a thousand limbs.

name: Adarkar Wastes
text: {T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.\n{T}: Add {W} or {U} to your mana pool. Adarkar Wastes deals 1 damage to you.

name: Brushland
text: {T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.\n{T}: Add {G} or {W} to your mana pool. Brushland deals 1 damage to you.

name: City of Brass
text: Whenever City of Brass becomes tapped, it deals 1 damage to you.\n{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

name: Karplusan Forest
text: {T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.\n{T}: Add {R} or {G} to your mana pool. Karplusan Forest deals 1 damage to you.

name: Sulfurous Springs
text: {T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.\n{T}: Add {B} or {R} to your mana pool. Sulfurous Springs deals 1 damage to you.

name: Underground River
text: {T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.\n{T}: Add {U} or {B} to your mana pool. Underground River deals 1 damage to you.
